title: Nethermind stops log output if NLog.config is changed
body:
**Description**
If I modify and save NLog.config while Nethermind is running, all output to the log file stops. Console output continues, and the program seems to work as normal in all other ways.  

**Steps to Reproduce**
1. Start Nethermind
2. Modify and save NLog.config.  The change can be anything ... even changing the wording of a comment.

**Actual behavior**
All output to log file folder stops.

**Expected behavior**
Output to log file should continue.


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
Please provide the following information regarding your setup:
 - Ubuntu 22.04.2
 - 1.19.2
 - Github release
 - Nimbus 23.5.1

**Logs**
I've included mainnet.logs.txt, console.txt (a log of the console output of Nethermind), and my NLog.config file, which I have modified to reduce verbosity to the console, but keep full detail to the log folder.

 - you can see the most recent start was at approximately 2023-06-21 08:49:22
 - at approximately 2023-06-21 08:52:24 I modified NLog.config, by simply changing the wording of a comment
 - when I saved NLog.config, you can see that all output to mainnet.logs.txt stopped, but output to the console continued.

[mainnet.logs.txt](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/11820328/mainnet.logs.txt)
[console.txt](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/11820331/console.txt)
[NLog.config.txt](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/files/11820336/NLog.config.txt)
